page.title: 16BRADFIELD-SOUTHEND
page.content: This is an area about one mile from Bradfield village. Housing is a mixture of owner occupier and council housing. There is old people housing both as small flats and bungalows.The primary school as some fine decorative brick work with a new classroom block. Southend farm buildings are used by a farm machinery firm. Another firm imports and distributes glassware for commercial dishwashers. There are three garages,a general store and a public house. St.Peters church is a wooden dual purpose building used for both services and church activites. The farm land is mostly grass for hay or grazing.The recreation ground includes a cricket pitch, football pitch and tennis courts and a village hall. Ther people work locally and commute to Reading or Newbury.
